definition: to get away from/to withdraw/to free oneself
to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: No longer able to step back from the first order pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 无法从初级快乐中抽身而出。

sentences.english: Omit the questionable passage and draw back from the edge.
sentences.chinese: 省去可疑的段落，从剽窃的边缘上抽身而退。

sentences.english: There is a person putting together my order and taking time away from his or her dine-in customers.
sentences.chinese: 人家从正在餐厅用餐的顾客那里抽身来为我订餐嘛。

sentences.english: Su Zengfu won't own any share of the company and that means the family frees itself from the company it founded.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着，苏氏家族进一步从自己创办的公司中抽身。

sentences.english: I volunteer because it takes me out of my daily life.
sentences.chinese: 我去做志愿者是因为它能让我从日常生活中抽身而出。

sentences.english: His reaction was to withdraw, to bury himself in work.
sentences.chinese: 他的反应是抽身而退，埋头于工作。

sentences.english: Gerty's first movement was one of revulsion .
sentences.chinese: 葛泰第一个动作是抽身后退一步。

sentences.english: But in college, Michelle suddenly pulled away.
sentences.chinese: 但到了大学时，米雪突然抽身。

sentences.english: Take that away, and the industry could suffer.
sentences.chinese: 如果政府决意抽身而退，整个行业将难以为继。

definition: to get away/to escape (from obligations)/to free oneself/to disengage
to leave in stealth/to slip away
lit. quick sword cuts through tangled hemp (idiom); decisive action in a complex situation/cutting the Gordian knot
to let go one's hold/to give up/to have a free hand
to avoid a problem by walking away from it/to quit
to escape unscathed/to get through in one piece
a blitzkrieg strategy (idiom)/to resolve sth in the shortest time possible/to get sth done quickly
not to get involved/to stay out of it
to escape without trace (idiom); to make one's getaway (from the scene of a crime)/to show a clean pair of heels
